title: The Marital downfall in Tennessee Williams' clothes for a summer hotel
abstract: This thesis is a study concerning Tennessee Williams'last major play,Clothes for a Summer Hotel. Here,the study of the idea of popularity and ambition as revealed through the main character,F.Scott Fitzgerald, becomes the major problem of the analysis.Both popu- larity and ambition have positive connotations.However, in this play both ideas refer to negative connotations, in a way that the influence of the popularity and ambi- tion toward the main character,F.Scott Fitzgerald, ruins his life.As a matter of fact,both ideas has led this couple to their marital downfall which happens when his wife,Zelda decides to leave him. Scott Fitzgerald,who is a major writer,is obsessed by his popularity and ambition.As an artist,he is obsessed to create brilliant works in order to maintain his good reputation as an outstanding writer.He be- comes selfish,workaholic and alcoholic due to his obsessions.His main purposes of life are writing and maintaining his established reputation since he considers
subjects: AMERICAN FICTION-20TH CENTURY-STUDY AND TEACHING; WILLIAMS, TENNESSEE, 1911-1983. CLOTHES FOR A SUMMER HOTEL-STUDY AND TEACHING
